post.body:
[Playhardtolittleget](https://ruqqus.com/@Playhardtolittleget), banned for doxxing

Discussion: https://ruqqus.com/+DelrayMisfits/post/5kae/why-the-fuck-was-i-banned

[arkitekt says](https://ruqqus.com/+DelrayMisfits/post/5kae/why-the-fuck-was-i-banned/jitt?context=3):

>i banned you after you posted an image of personal chat with full name and phone number

Both the name and phone number were fake according to Playhardtolittleget.

[captainmeta4 says](https://ruqqus.com/+DelrayMisfits/post/5kae/why-the-fuck-was-i-banned/jjtv):

>It doesn't matter if it's "fake" - nobody wants us to waste time investigating whether or not PI is real when we could be developing features instead.

The current rule against doxxing is [this](https://archive.is/ZTEqI):

***

You may not use ruqqus.com to do any of the following:

3\. Solicit, collect, or publish personal information, either yours or another individual's

* This does not include information that is already publically available, such as public figures' names, government contact info, etc.

***

body:
I've seen that idea suggested before, and it seems good for transparency. So far, the admins seem to be operating like this:

* Spam: 1 day (autoban)
* Digitally malicious content: 30 days (autoban)
* Unmarked NSFW: I'm not sure how long, but it seems to be from 1-3 days
* Threatening the president as a joke: 3 days (based on SentientSquirrel77's ban)
* Doxxing: Permaban
* Staff Impersonation: Permaban
* Legal threats (including as a joke): Permaban + cut off all communication
* Minor sexualization: Permaban
* Circumventing per-account limitations: 7 day ban on main + alts permabanned
* Targeted harassment / intimidation: Not sure; miikit was banned (even though others said he wasn't really harassing milkit) permanently, but I don't know who else has been banned for this so far

Let's ask the admins about this

@captainmeta4 @kek @arkitekt, SirSteve suggests having "a set of punishments for the rules". What do you think?

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

body:
[See the evolution of the front page here](https://web.archive.org/web/*/ruqqus.com)

I wouldn't really call the posts on the front page "libertarian" as much as I'd just call it right-wing politics. I also don't remember seeing that much "computer nerd stuff" in June. I remember mostly seeing anti-reddit posts back then.

I'd say that the increase in political posts is partially because of the reddit ban waves. On June 29, reddit banned a lot of subreddits, many of which were right wing, and that brought a lot of users over. Over time, reddit also banned a ton of other subreddits, and some of their users may have also decided to go on ruqqus (an example is that some users from anti-mask subreddits have gone to +LostSkeptics). Several attempts to bring users over from non-banned or non-political subreddits, such as /r/Animemes, didn't really work since they're still free to make new subs on reddit without reddit banning all of them. So with the ban wave refugees posting political content that overwhelms the relatively small amount of non-political content on the site, political users who feel disenfranchised on platforms like reddit would be attracted, especially because this site is relatively free-speech compared to other sites, while most non-political users don't really have any incentive to go here since they're not getting censored on the big sites like reddit. Users who want to "post computer nerd stuff" can post it both here and on reddit, and they'll most likely get more engagement on reddit. Meanwhile, users who want to post far-right or racist stuff are probably going to get banned on reddit, so they're the kinds of users who move here.

The admins on the site see this and want to add features to make ruqqus its own platform and not just a "right wing reddit" or a "less censored reddit".

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

So with the ban wave refugees posting political content that overwhelms the relatively small amount of non-political content on the site, political users who feel disenfranchised on platforms like reddit would be attracted, especially because this site is relatively free-speech compared to other sites, while most non-political users don't really have any incentive to go here since they're not getting censored on the big sites like reddit. guild.description:
Your guild for discussing all things trans.

**RULES**

Rulebreaking will lead to kicks, repeated rulebreaking will lead to a ban.

1. **No hate speech.** This is not limited to trans- and enbyphobia, and does include slurs.

2. **No shitposting.** High-effort memes, comics and artwork are welcome.

3. **Keep things relevant.** Posts should be about being trans or non-binary, or related to it.

4. **Stay posi!** Harrassment and bullying are not tolerated here, and will not be. Please don't put yourself down for any reason, you're all wonderful.

5. **Please no NSFW content.** Discussions about top or bottom surgery and sexual health do not count under this.

6. **Use appropriate warnings for sensitive subjects.** Overly triggering topics should be marked with a Content Warning (CW) like so:

CW: Bread

Today I baked a loaf of bread. It smelled very good and I sliced it up to make some toast

  5. Please no NSFW content. Discussions about top or bottom surgery and sexual health do not count under this.

  6. Use appropriate warnings for sensitive subjects. Overly triggering topics should be marked with a Content Warning (CW) like so:

CW: Bread

Today I baked a loaf of bread. It smelled very good and I sliced it up to make some toast

guild.name: changelog

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

3: Can there be an "actual all" that shows all guilds except for those that opted out of All for those who are lazy?

body:
* Arts: Visual/Drawings
* Gaming: Mobile (Also, what would board games/card games/those types of games count as? Hobbies?)
* Lifestyle: Pets
* Politics: Moderate
* Science: Chemistry, Math (even though it's not necessarily a "science")
* Sports: There are tons of sports. If you're limiting it to categories about specific sports, it's going to be hard to choose. Broader categories like "winter sports" would be good.

If you would allow us to choose one of the main categories (like "science" rather than "physics") rather than a subcategory, it would be nice. Or add a subcategory under each main category called "general". Currently, these subcategories don't seem like enough to encompass everything.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
• Arts: Visual/Drawings
  • Gaming: Mobile (Also, what would board games/card games/those types of games count as? Hobbies?)
  • Lifestyle: Pets
  • Politics: Moderate
  • Science: Chemistry, Math (even though it's not necessarily a "science")
  • Sports: There are tons of sports. If you're limiting it to categories about specific sports, it's going to be hard to choose. Broader categories like "winter sports" would be good.

If you would allow us to choose one of the main categories (like "science" rather than "physics") rather than a subcategory, it would be nice. Or add a subcategory under each main category called "general". Currently, these subcategories don't seem like enough to encompass everything.

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

body:
>All section that doesn't show everything by default

Maybe I'll keep pushing for an "unfiltered all" even though the admins said they were kind of iffy on it the last time I asked.

Edit: SaidIt also hides subs from /s/all, but it has /subs/notall. I know the admins really want guilds to be categorized, but like u_MaxwellHill, I don't want guilds with inactive GMs to become too negatively affected by this. The admins say they could categorize them themselves, but that doesn't sound too feasible considering the amount of guilds on ruqqus. The main page could have only categorized guilds (and explicitly say that\*), while a separate "unfiltered all" could be like the one we used to have.

Rather than punishing subs like this for not being categorized, maybe there should be some other incentive to do it (I can't think of anything other than free coins though).

\*"This is the All page. Only guilds in categories you've chosen will appear here. Go to (wherever it is because I have no idea where it is on mobile) to choose the categories you want to see. Political guilds and uncategorized guilds are hidden by default."

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

post.body:
As Voat is preparing to shut down shortly, I feel it needs to be said that Voat refugees are always welcome here in +WhiteGenocide. I am the creator and original moderator here, and have been somewhat active on both Ruqqus and Voat for several months now with the same username. I have added @Hyperborean as a mod as well in an effort to prevent any type of siege or undermining of this guild's moderation. Ruqqus may not be Voat, but so long as the site owners allow it, I will commit to NEVER censor any form of free speech here. Spam is an exception that will be dealt with on an individual basis as needed, but otherwise, I will let the community self regulate as it should through votes. You have my word, for what it's worth, that you can speak your mind freely here, and I encourage that you do so. Please try to keep topics in some way relevant to the Guild description, or derivatives of that theme. In a world where the White community and society is increasingly demonized and marginalized, it is absolutely vital to allow and encourage free discussion and realization of this phenomenon, and who is supporting it. 

In the spirit of growing like-minded communities here, I will also allow ONE post per guild referring users to another ideologically related guild here on Ruqqus, should anyone wish to promote a related guild. Pease do not abuse this. 

Welcome Goats and all others who have noticed that White Genocide is far more than a conspiracy theory!
